titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 32
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in pencil by a modern hand. Secundo folio: audiam cum eis

p.note: Table of content by a later hand in dark brown ink.
Vadstena library’s shelfmark "F 20 10us" at the top of the recto of the front endleaf.
Scattered words written on the inside cover by a medieval hand in a black/dark-brown ink, possibly a pen-trial.
"247", unidentified number in ink on the bottom part of the pastedown.

binding.p:
Contemporary blindstamped binding from Vadstena Monastery, probably by Niels bookbinder, active in Vadstena at the end of the 15th century; see Collijn (1903)
. Several examples of stamps used by Niels are found in Sten G. Lindberg’s archive, Kungliga Biblioteket, Band 10:4 Niels–band och andra gnidebilder, Acc. 2005/28.

Torn brown tanned leather over wooden boards, blind-stamped. Front cover: tools scattered within a frame using 5 stamps; lower cover lozenges formed from fillets, tools symmetrically arranged. The covering is cracked on the spine and at the front; 4 double spinebands plus endbands; two hook-strap with clasp fastenings passing to upper cover.
Unidentified post-medieval pressmark, "CC", at the head of the spine in brown ink.
Old signum "131" in blank ink on the middle of the spine. Current signum "A 32" in gold beneath the old signum and the remains of an old label at the bottom of the spine.

history.provenance: 1. According to the list compiled by Johannes Bureus delivered from the Vadstena monastery to the National Archives, see Gödel (1916) Appendix 2 , and to the receipt by Peder Månsson Utter, see Gödel (1916) Appendix 3 . 2. Antikvitetsarkivet, listed in the old handwritten catalogues/inventories as "MSS in folio, nr. 145" (U 90:1); "nr. 131" (U 90:2, f. 12v); "nr 131" (U 90:4 p. 58); "nr. I 131" (U 91:1). Berch’s catalogue, shelf mark A 22 (current signum).
history.acquisition: From Antikvitetsarkivet to the National Library.

msItem.title: The Revelations of Sancta Birgitta, Book 5
msItem.rubric: prologus libri questionum qui est quintus liber celestium revelacionum beate Birgitte
msItem.incipit: Incipit Quintus liber celestium revelacionum Christi ad beatam Birgittam de regno Swecie
msItem.explicit: Ergo qui ad ista loca uenerunt mundus cum bona et perfecta uoluntate habebit uidere et gustare quam dulcis et suauis sum ego deus Itaque cum ueneris ad ista loca ostendam tibi plura et cetera

msItem.title: The Revelations of Sancta Birgitta, Book 6
msItem.rubric: Incipit sextus liber revelacionum celestium beate Birgitte de regno Swecie rubrica primi capituli. Verba matris dei ad sponsam narrancia pulchritudinem Christi et qualiter frequenter iudei in aliquo agone cordis positi ibant ad inspiciendum vultum eius et consolabantur Capitulum primum
msItem.incipit: Mater dei loquabatur ad sponsam dicens Ego sum regina celi
msItem.explicit: Alioquin labor suus supervacuus et oracio sua erunt ei minus in coronam

msItem.title: The Revelations of Sancta Birgitta, Book 7
msItem.rubric: Incipit septimus liber celestium Reuelacionum Beate Birgitte de regno Swecie Rubrica primi capituli. Reuelacio quam habuit domina Birgitta in Roma post annum Iubilei in qua uirgo Maria pronunciat ei que itura esset in iherusalem et bethleem quando placuit deo promittens ei tunc ostendere sibi modum quomodo ipsa peperit filium suum benedictum
msItem.incipit: Cum esset in Roma Beata birgitta sponsa christi et quadam uice oracioni
msItem.explicit: Dicta uero missa et sacramentis perceptis cum maxima deuocione et reuerencia inter manus predictarum personarum emisit spiritum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit septimus liber celestis reuelacionum christi ad sponsam beatam Birgittam

msItem.title: Epistola solitarii ad reges
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola solitarii ad Reges. Reprehendit hic illi qui ex abrupto et improuiso nullo examine precedente approbant aut reprobant personas se asserentes habere uisiones et reuelationes diuinas
msItem.incipit: O Serenissimi Reges utinam ueri reges in christo
msItem.explicit: ut ex omnibus supradictis patet breuiter ex dictis omnium doctorum et sanctorum patrum super hac materia multipharie diffuse loquencium

msItem.title: Prologus Libri Celestis Imperatoris ad Reges
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus libri celestis imperatoris ad reges in quo continetur modus compilacionis eius Et admonentur reges et principes quod recipiant hunc librum deuote et humiliter de manu dei et cum corde et opere sequantur hanc doctrinam frequenter. Capitulum viii
msItem.incipit: Ad presentis quippe libri nunc iam materiam descendendo Sciendum est quod iste liber infrascriptus intitulatur Celestis imperatoris ad reges
msItem.explicit: Qui rex est regum ac dominus dominancium in secula seculorum Amen

msItem.title: The Revelations of Sancta Birgitta, Book 8
msItem.rubric: Incipit octauus liber celestis Imperatoris ad reges reuelacionum diuinitus Beate brigitte de regno Swecie Rubrika primi capituli. / Summus imperator Christi per sponsam loquitur ad reges ostendens se esse uerum omnium creatorem et regem in trinitate et unitate regnantem Et dicit qualiter mundum ordinauit regendum duplici potestate scilicet ecclesiastica et laycali qui in apostolis petro et paulo principaliter designantur Capitulum primum
msItem.incipit: Vidi pallacium grande incomprehensibile magnitudine simile celo sereno
msItem.explicit: Excutite graue iugum dyaboli a uobis et recordemini caritatis mee et uidebitis in consciencia uestra quod ego sum suauis et mitis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber octauus celestis imperatoris ad reges

supportDesc.condition: Holes in the parchment and cut corners throughout the manuscript, but no loss of text. Some of the holes are circled with red ink.

layout.note: Occasional ruling and pricking in the outer margins. Guidelines in lead.

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida and Cursive by several scribes

p.note: Scattered additions and corrections in the margins by a contemporary hand.

decoDesc.p: 9-line framed historiated pen-drawn initial C(um) at the start of Book VII, puzzle, in red and green ink with a goat and a dog; frame decorated with pen-flourishing;
9-line decorated pen-drawn initial O (Serenissimi) in black, red and green ink at the text opening, framed with pen-flourishing. unfinished decorated 6-line initial V(idi) at the start of Book VIII.

, , : 2-8 line red and green initials with pen-flourishing in opposite colour, some with ornament in the counter space; ff. 2-3 line black initials with mainly red pen-flourishing , : pen-drawn plain coloured red and green initials, some within the counter spaces.

msItem.title: Sermo Angelicus
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo angelicus de excelencia beate marie uirginis quem ipse angelus dictauit beate birgitte ex precepto dei Et ipsa ex eodem precepto deuote conscripsit Capitulum primum etc
msItem.incipit: Verbum de quo ewangelista Iohannes in ewangelio suo facit mencionem ab eterno erat cum patre et spiritu sancto unus deus
msItem.explicit: qui cum patre et spiritu sancto uivit et regnat per infinita secula seculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo angelicus de excellencia beate marie uirginis gloriose

supportDesc.condition: : Leaves stained, but does not affect legibility.

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida and Cursive by several scribes

p.note: Minor contemporary additions in the margins
